subject: Programming
title: The Equifax Data Breach
description: Learn The Equifax Data Breach in one minute.

hook.text: In 2017, hackers stole the personal data of 147 million Americans from a credit bureau.

buildup.text: Equifax held names, Social Security numbers, and addresses for nearly every US adult.

discovery.text: Attackers exploited a known vulnerability in Apache Struts. A patch had been available for months.

twist.text: Equifax knew about the flaw but failed to apply the update. Internal security scans also failed.

climax.text: The breach cost Equifax over $1.4 billion and exposed systemic negligence in corporate security.

punchline.text: A patch existed for months. Nobody applied it.

quiz.question: How many Americans were affected by the Equifax breach?
